oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-02-25 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 25, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Cowboy Copas (host/performer), guest performers Carl Butler and the Webster Brothers, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Dale Potter, Lew Childre, Del Wood, Minnie Pearl, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Del Wood; Minnie Pearl; Carl Butler; Webster Brothers; Grandpa Jones; Cowboy Copas
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Cowboy Copas introduces Del Wood -- Ain't She Sweet (Del Wood) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Carl Butler introduces Carl Butler and the Webster Brothers -- Only One Heart (Carl Butler and the Webster Brothers) -- Cowboy Copas introduces Grandpa Jones -- Company's Coming (Grandpa Jones) -- National Guard P.S.A. (Grant Turner) -- Cowboy Copas talks -- Any Old Time (Cowboy Copas) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Cowboy Copas, Grant Turner) -- Cavalier Cigarettes commercial -- Station announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Wood, Del; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Potter, Dale; Copas, Cowboy; Butler, Carl; Webster Brothers
